intro: Coronopus didymus var. incisus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heartwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its small, pale blue to violet flowers that are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. The leaves are narrow and often have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
